title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
key_ideas: Focus only on what you can control. External events are indifferent.
Accept what happens without complaint. Nature's will is rational.
Practice self-examination daily. Reflect on your actions and thoughts.
Death is natural and inevitable. Live virtuously while you can.
Other people's opinions don't define you. Your character is your own.
Turn obstacles into opportunities. Every challenge is a chance to practice virtue.

micro_lessons.title: The Dichotomy of Control
micro_lessons.core_idea: Some things are within our control, others are not. Focus only on the former.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What is the fundamental distinction in Stoic philosophy?
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: The distinction between what we can control (our judgments, desires, actions) and what we cannot (external events, others' opinions).

micro_lessons.title: Acceptance of Nature
micro_lessons.core_idea: Accept what happens as part of nature's rational order. Resistance causes suffering.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: How should one respond to unfavorable events?
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: Accept them as part of nature's will, without complaint or resistance, recognizing they are outside our control.
